knimeNode.name: RDKit Salt Stripper
knimeNode.shortDescription: Node for stripping salts from molecules.

fullDescription.intro: This node is used for removing salts from RDKit molecules and display the salt stripped molecules in an additional column in the output table. The user can optionally input salt definitions into the node. If no salt definition table is provided by the user then the default salt definitions will be applied.

tab.name: Options
tab.option: The name of the column in first table containing RDKit molecules for stripping.
The new name of the column that will contained the salt stripped molecule.
Toggles removal of the input RDKit Mol column in the output table.
The name of the column in the optional second table containing RDKit molecules as salt definitions (generated usually from SMARTS). This only applies, if a second table is connected.

option.name: Keep only largest fragment after salt stripping

tab.option: Option to reduce the salt stripping outcome even more keeping only the largest fragment of all remaining fragments. If there are multiple fragments with the same number of atoms identified as largest fragments, it will keep only the first one it encounters.

ports.inPort: Table having at least one RDKit molecule type column containing RDKit molecules for stripping.
Table containing RDKit molecules as salt definitions (generated usually from SMARTS). This table is optional.
ports.outPort: Table containing the column with salt stripped RDKit molecules.
